tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Schenker to Cube, dated July 6, 1932

tei:transcription.tei:p: {recto} Absender: Schenker Igls b/Insbr. Igler Hof Tirol
[An:] H Prof [/] Felix v. Cube Hamburg 37 Innocentiastr. [/] 11
[postmark:] [[ [illeg] | [illeg] | b || [for continuation of recto, see below]
{verso} Lieber Prof. v. Cube! Writing of this postcard is recorded in Schenker's diary, OJ 4/5, p. 3746, July 6, 1932.

Bestätige den Empfang Ihres l.[ieben] Schreibens, = OJ 11/54, [33], July 2, 1932. die große Schuld nun beider Sendungen trage ich demnächst ab; heute nur <strike>eine</strike> ^die^ erfreuliche Meldung, daß “Onkel Otto” Click on Otto Vrieslander, frequently referred to as “Uncle Otto.” Schenker recommended these collections of published songs to several of his correspondents. 2 Hefte (schönster) Lieder ^u. 1. Heft^ (schönster) Ländler mit Kleins’ Klein [identify] Bildschmuck bei Grünert Leipzig herausgebracht hat. Wirklich beste Kunst, ein erststau[n]liches Kunstwerk dazu!
Teilen Sie, bitte, davon auch Prof. Violin| Click on Moriz Violin. mit,
{recto} Beste Grüße von uns Beiden in Eile Ihr [signed:] H Schenker 6. 7. 32

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Schenker to Cube, dated July 6, 1932

tei:translation.tei:p: {recto} [From:] Schenker, Igls near Innsbruck, Igler Hof, Tirol
[To:] Prof. Felix von Cube, Hamburg 37, Innocentiastraße 11
[postmark:] [[ [illeg] | [illeg] | b || [for continuation of recto, see below]

I confirm receipt of your lovely letter. The great debt I owe you for both transmissions is something I will discharge soon. Today I merely send you the cheering news that “Uncle Otto” has published, with the Leipzig firm of Grünert, two volumes of (the most beautiful) songs ^and one volume^ of (the most beautiful ) Ländler adorned with pictures by Klein. Truly the best art, and a most astonishing work of art!
Please also tell Prof. Violin about this.
{recto} Best greetings from the two of us. In haste, Yours, [signed:] H. Schenker July 6, 1932
